Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Jones, the USA’s biggest player with the bat, will not be intimidated by the prospect of playing against some of the biggest superstars in the game.
Several of these Indian-origin players in the USA side have played with and against some members of the Indian squad while growing up in India.
India are not planning to take the game ‘lightly’, according to their bowling coach Paras Mhambrey.
India could be tempted to rest their star pacer Jasprit Bumrah and bring in one of their two spinners – Kuldeep Yadav and Yuzvendra Chahal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The two sides have never played a cricket match in any format of the game.
The pitch in New York has steadily improved over the past 10 days and despite offering plenty of assistance to bowlers, it has become relatively easier to bat on.
Captains winning the toss are still choosing to bowl first to make use of any added advantage in the morning.
